name: ampliseq-its-mycobiome
title: Ampliseq: ITS Fungal Microbiome
description: ITS (Internal Transcribed Spacer) amplicon sequencing for fungal community profiling. DADA2-based ASV calling with UNITE taxonomy. Ideal for mycobiome studies. Samplesheet format: `sampleID,forwardReads,reverseReads`
command: nextflow run nf-core/ampliseq --input ${input} --outdir ${outdir} --FW_primer CTTGGTCATTTAGAGGAAGTAA --RV_primer GCTGCGTTCTTCATCGATGC --dada_ref_taxonomy unite-fungi -r 2.11.0
content:
Ampliseq: ITS Fungal Profiling

ITS amplicon sequencing targets fungal communities. ITS1/ITS2 regions are the barcode for fungal species identification, analogous to 16S for bacteria.

Applications

  • Human Mycobiome: Gut fungi, skin (Malassezia)
  • Plant-Fungal Interactions: Mycorrhizae, pathogens
  • Environmental Fungi: Soil, decomposition
  • Clinical: Candida, Aspergillus infections

Key Outputs

  • ASV Table: Fungal feature counts
  • Taxonomy: UNITE database classification
  • Diversity Metrics: Alpha and beta diversity
  • Guild Assignment: Pathotroph, saprotroph, symbiotroph

Perfect for: Fungal microbiome • Mycobiome • Plant-fungal • Environmental fungi
